reviews.review:
Concept is genuinely appealing, game perks, maps, characters are great, However, level scaling (match making). Definitely not fun for newbie, or newer players (you get the idea), going against red, gold or just high ranks. Especially, playing Killers, survivors have the upper hand to the point, where it's not as fun anymore. (Aside from rlly painful perks to deal with such as borrowed time, Decisive strike, but sure, fine these perks can be dealt with), but the main concern is with 4-man teams, which renders some Killer perks as kinda useless, the body blocking which makes it just embarrassing/shameful and barely enough time to go to a different hook. (T-bagging at the gate to keep the killers hostage in game, its just annoying, not rlly game affecting but still....annoying). Prob someone will try to suggest some stuff like Blood warden (Sure, IF you don't get body blocked), NOED? (no one escapes death), sure works....if hex totems are still up by the end game) . Keep watch of totems then? Sure, oh but gens are all almost done if not half of em, and if you include survivors looping, blinding and everything, time-wise, very risky. Get perks/ hex totems that slow/regress gen progress? Then wheres the space for NOED, blood warden, and some other perks? So, basically it's just a very meta kind of game, where unless you goin against low lvl survivors, or just lucky in general, then I guess its more of a Survivors vs Clown, rather than Survivors vs Killer. (Sure, there might be some counters to what I've said, but I don't suppose players who don't have all the teach-able perks nor the perks from DLC killers, will prob have a very difficult time). Aside from the complaints, the game is very intriguing, interesting designs, lore, killer abilities, perks and the like. 

From the survivor Perspective, sure it can sometimes be difficult to escape from the killer, due to their abilities, Add-ons etc. However, the killer is supposed to have a bit of an upper hand, when hunting down survivors, (1 v 4), even with skill, it's not as easy as it looks. For the survivor-side, its less of a meta type of game play (Not saying there is none), but it allows for many different combinations of perks which can't be removed (sure sometimes be rendered useless/less effective due to killer perks, but remember its a 1 v 4), and it just depends on your luck, if the killer has perks against you or not I guess. Coop play in survivors is fun, but only when the killer gets bullied, which just makes the Killer just seem less intimidating and just more pitiful.

Edit: I don't get the point of Pig anymore, like she was point blank nerfed, making her essentially not very good, if not bad in the endgame, and she only has 4 Reverse bear traps, which are easily disabled, or survivors can just simply run out the exit when they aren't activated. Heck, even I have had a few games (idk if its a bug or something I'm missing), where even if the trap is activated, it won't kill the survivor when they leave the exit. (Yes, sure just chase or whatev advice, but when you going against a 4-man.....it just becomes real difficult to actually get em to die by trap, even if you chase that one single trapped survivor, all the gens will prob be done....and not even a confirmed kill, but by luck if they even die to trap due to the bug stated previously.

Another problem, I've had toxic players (ofc I'm aware of how toxic ppl can get and such, but some are just way over the line), that had insults both their team mates and the killer that goes way over the line with toxicity, such as death-threats towards me or those I know, and nothing has been done against them. Steam Player tags that gave death-threats and constant insults in-game  "이걸 못잡노? ㅋ" and "124시간 데린이". Maybe I'm going overboard but still.
Игра говно не покупайте имбаланс ебаный
makes me want to throw myself onto a highway sometimes but i love it

Игра довольно-таки веселая даже если не с кем играть.
Я рекомендую эту игру, играйте и не жалейте себя и свое время.
В игре есть нормальная система наказания читеров и игроков специально сливающих катку. Играя за выживших вы не будете сталкиваться с ними, по этому если у вас нет пати, не беда, вежливые, опытные товарищи из радомного поиска смогут вытащить вас из любой сложной катки. Но и тут все не однозначно поскольку в игре есть баланс! Новеньким игрокам никогда не поставят опытного или турнирного мана и вы ничего с этим не сделаете. Весь опыт и удовольствие от игры будет только положительным.
В игре вообще почти нет проблем.
В игре не встречаются баги. Такие баги, как получения удара от убийцы находясь от того в метрах 6-10, неработающие квесты и награды за их выполнение, вечно лагающие карты не зависимо от качества вашего интернета, это все бредни хейтеров.
Новая система рангов с обновлением Hellraiser по началу казалась на удивление хорошей и 13 числа мы увидели настоящий прорыв в ранговой системе!
Делать сброс ранга целенаправленным каждый месяц на начальный - это лучшее что могли придумать. Ведь нужно каждый раз доказывать самому себе что ты лучший и стремится становится ещё лучше, каждый раз! Надеюсь что никогда не вернут в игру сброс ранга как было до обновления Hellraiser и оставят всё так, как есть сейчас!

o preço do jogo é aceitável para o que ele oferece, mas se puder esperar uma promoção, eu recomendo, consegui uma edição especial por 27 reais, ao invés de apenas o jogo por 39,99

I first played this game on my Playstation and earlier this year I switched to my computer. 
I absolutley love this game. I know it can be frustration to always die (as a survivor) or dont get any kills (as the killer) but to play with friends is just fun. 
On some days the waiting to find a game can be boring but I think that it actually got better. The longest I had to wait recently was 3 Minutes. So that is completly ok. 

The game never gets boring for me.

While I generally love this game, I have a few warnings to those who are interested in buying it.

The community can be toxic as hell. There's three basic types of toxicity.

New players who are uninformed (not your fault) who do things the community considers bad manners.
Experienced perfectionists.
People who enjoy other's suffering.

Higher learning curve than some expect.

Learning survivor and killer perks is important regardless of what you main.
Common tactics to avoid getting downed or looped.
Prioritization/situational awareness. Where is everyone, what are they doing, what should you be doing?.
Community slang.

Matchmaking leaves a lot to be desired.

Inexperienced paired with experienced... but in a "one gets dunked on" arrangement, not teaching.
Sometimes (often) seems to be under the influence when making lobbies.
wait.... ...... .............. .......................................... ....... times............................. ....... ............. ........ .... .....

HOWEVER, there's some pretty nifty things....

DLC characters can be unlocked through gameplay.

It takes 9000 iridescent shards, which are gained through leveling one's account up.
The Shrine of Secrets changes every week, and potentially has perks from DLC characters available.
Folks who can't afford DLC can still get the characters & perks.

Friends not required but make experience better.

No in-game voice chat for survivors, some use Discord instead.
In-game emotes used to communicate, as well as crouching.
Relatively easy to find new friends if you're nice, most people who play survivor want full SWF crews.

Replayable

Wide variety of maps, characters, perks.
Opportunity for a wide variety of play styles.
Private or public matches for whatever your purpose, including goofing off.

Lots of shenanigans

Get waterboarded by puke
Throw a flashlight rave
Thiccness knows no morals or gender

Overall, I'd recommend. Probably about a 8.5/10. Have not pooped my pants due to this game but have come close a time or two. Thanks, Ghost Face.

---------------------------------------

UPDATE (May 28 2021):

New content is still being released!

More mechanics are being added to the game, which changes how survivors play. Ex: Zombies being added in the R.E. chapter (in Player Test Build at the time of this update).
Some cosmetics can be purchased with shards, unlocked through game-play, or redeemed via codes released by BHVR.
Periodic events. Currently, there's an event to find Gnome Chompski once the exit gates are powered.

Map and graphical updates.

The game generally looks a lot better now.
Multiple variants of maps.
Maps tend to be smaller now, which can be both good and bad. Gens feel closer together but that also applies to hooks.

The Rift

A battle pass has been added to the game.
Auric cells (paid currency) are part of the reward system- if you complete the Rift you actually get your money back!
Players are rewarded with cosmetics, lore (The Archives), and various forms of in-game currency.
Challenges from the Rift add an extra layer of fun (or psychological distress and anguish) to matches.

Matchmaking... Again

Queue times are substantially faster for survivors in the morning than in the afternoon/evening.
I'm a filthy survivor main heathen, so I can only assume that means killer queue times are better in the afternoon/evening.
Still occasionally end up in lobbies that are very unbalanced or entirely unfair, but it's better than it used to be.
There's a lot more player consistency in terms of skill, but also toxicity, in higher ranks.
If you want to meme and enjoy, the higher ranks tend to be very serious...

HIT BOXES MAKE ME CRY.

This is just a game.
Please, self... It's just a game...
Sobbing intensifies.
In all seriousness though, the hit boxes need some improvement. Lag, frame-perfect timing, and other aspects all influence whether the hatchet hits your face or clips through your face.
I may be a survivor main, but if a Huntress nails me across the map, I'm impressed with the shot and outraged on the killer's behalf if it doesn't register.

What accessibility options?

Changing the struggle phase on hook to a series of skill checks was a huge improvement in terms of accessibility for wider audiences.
An option to suppress screen flashing effects or toggle an alternate view for them would be helpful. A fade-in, solid color, then fade-out screen aura might be a good option for this? It would preserve visual information without giving an 'unfair advantage' to players.
For the record, players with disabilities just wanna grind for bloodpoints and cry like everyone else. If your primary concern is giving players an 'unfair advantage,' please remember that accessibility options compensate for a set-back so that people with disabilities have an even playing field.

I'd say that the changes boost my rating to a 9/10, but the hit box issues can definitely make this game feel like a 2/10.

To BHVR, if they ever stumble their way into this review:
The new content is great but please look into hit registration and hit boxes. Accessibility options for a wide range of players would also be highly appreciated and it would increase audience reach and profitability. Keep up the good work.

É um bom jogo, mas tem o seu maior defeito como um jogo multiplayer online atual: a comunidade.

É impressionante, independente do lado que você está, sempre tem algo para quebrar tuas pernas.

Se você for sobrevivente, existe a problemática chamada outros sobreviventes, aonde o povo vai cair pro assassino em 20s de partida e vão quitar, depois xingar no chat, ou só continuar jogando normalmente, não fazer nada e ai sim te xingar. Ai você junta outros 3 amigos e fala "pô, vencemo na vida", para logo em seguida tomar um assassino que joga do jeito mais boring imaginável, como o povo campando, para ser carregado pelo NOED depois.

Se você for assassino, se prepara para 415343151 loops infinitos e god pallets, aonde ou você usa perks de desacelerar geradores ou todos os geradores são feitos em meros segundos. Nisso, você ainda vai presenciar a diversão que é o meta dos mesmos 4 perks de sobreviventes que só existem para te encher o saco, como dead hard e decisive strike, que TODO MUNDO usa, uma verdadeira mentalidade coletiva. Para, no final, ter 4 pessoas no portão clickando a lanterna na sua cara e depois te escaralhando no chat pós-jogo.

Mesmo com esses problemas, o jogo é bom? a resposta é: acho bom, de verdade. Tem muita variedade de assassinos e sobreviventes, assim como perks que mudam bastante o jogo, só não ficar estacionado nos mesmos perks de sempre que dá para se divertir.

Conclusão: Tem paciência o bastante para aguentar toxicidade? vai com tudo.
